result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Charlotte R Bushey in court.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Chris Kuehn appeared. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Reading of complaint waived. Rights given and preliminary hearing requested and time period waived. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Charlotte R Bushey
Current: N7337 Nine Indian Tr, Elkhorn, WI 53121 United States  (Effective: 10-28-2022)
Prior: N9590 Sunset Dr, Troy Twp, WI 53120
Signed bond filed with the court.

BOND TO BE COSIGNED BY SHAUN BUSHEY OR CORA BUSHEY

NO CONTACT WITH MINORS OTHER THAN INCIDENTAL. MAY HAVE SUPERVISED CONTACT WITH IMMEDIATE FAMILY. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH E.F.L. dob 7-14-2009, J.R.L. dob 3-24-1989, Z.S.L. dob 4-29-2013, S.M.L. dob 8-12-1986, AND J.R.L. dob 4-28-2011. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 
22-4531

Defendant Charlotte R Bushey in court, in custody by video. Attorney Vivien TenHaken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jason Daane appeared. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Defendant's parents are present and are willing to co-sign a bond. Surety bond set. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
